benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/availableBasePlans - Retrieve available base plans

covered: Valid requests: Successful retrieval with and without accountId are covered (TC01, TC02) including checks for 200 status and Content-Type application/json.
Empty response handling: Catalog-empty scenarios covered (TC03, TC14) to validate 200 with an empty JSON array.

Query parameter handling and input validation: Tests for valid accountId, non-existent accountId, invalid format, unsupported/extra parameters (TC02, TC04, TC05, TC08) plus security checks for SQL injection and XSS (TC12, TC13).
Authentication: Unauthorized access is tested (TC06) and expects 401 for missing/invalid tokens.
Error and dependency handling: Service-unavailable (TC07), timeout (TC17), and degraded dependent service / partial responses (TC16) are included.
Performance and scalability: Normal and peak-load performance tests and large-payload handling are present (TC09, TC10, TC11).
Security and regression: Injection/XSS tests (TC12, TC13) and regression for empty arrays (TC14) are present.
Backward compatibility & integration: Version compatibility check (TC15) and integration-related behavior (TC16) are covered.
Accessibility & format: Valid JSON and machine-readable structure checked (TC18).
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios validate pagination parameters (page/limit/offset), paging headers/links, or behavior when requesting pages outside range.
Caching behavior: No tests for caching headers (ETag, If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since, Cache-Control, Last-Modified, Vary) or conditional requests (304 responses).
Rate limiting/throttling: No tests to trigger or validate rate limits (e.g., 429 + Retry-After) under burst traffic.

Authorization/tenant isolation: Missing tests for 403 Forbidden (insufficient permissions), expired tokens vs. valid-but-forbidden tokens, and explicit tenant-scoped catalog isolation / cross-tenant access control.

Schema & contract validation: Although tests assert "required fields", there is no strict JSON Schema/contract validation of PlanDetail (data types, nested objects, optional vs required fields, enums).
Generic server errors: No explicit tests for generic 500 Internal Server Error responses and verification that error payloads do not leak sensitive/internal data (stack traces, DB info).
Content negotiation & headers: No tests for Accept header variations, unsupported media types (406) or Content-Encoding/Vary behavior.
Large-response integrity: While large payload handling is asserted, there are no explicit checks for chunked transfer, Content-Length correctness, or streaming integrity for very large responses.
Concurrent consistency: No tests for concurrent catalog updates vs reads (consistency under concurrent modifications) where relevant.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: create scenarios with page/limit/offset query parameters (when API supports them), verify correct subsets, boundary conditions (empty page, last page), and presence/semantics of pagination headers or links.
Add caching/conditional-request tests: verify ETag and Last-Modified are returned, If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since produce 304 when unchanged, and Cache-Control headers are present and correct.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts to validate 429 responses and Retry-After header; include normal behavior after backoff.
Expand authorization tests: add cases for valid but unauthorized tokens returning 403, expired tokens, role-based access control, and explicit cross-tenant access checks to ensure tenant isolation.
Add strict schema/contract tests: implement JSON Schema validation for PlanDetail objects (field presence, types, nested objects, enums) and include negative tests for malformed PlanDetail content.

Add generic error handling tests: simulate 500 Internal Server Error and assert safe, consistent error format without sensitive details; confirm endpoints return >=400 for various error scenarios per spec.
Add content negotiation tests: send different Accept headers (e.g., application/xml, */*) to validate 406 or correct fallback and check Vary/Content-Encoding headers.

Add large-response integrity tests: validate Content-Length or chunked transfer encoding correctness, verify no truncation under streaming clients, and test client resume/partial download behavior if applicable.
Add concurrency/consistency tests: simulate concurrent catalog updates and GETs to verify read consistency and define expected behavior (eventual consistency vs transactional snapshot).

Operationalize contract and performance tests in CI: automate JSON schema checks, include performance thresholds/SLA assertions for TC09/TC10, and add mocks for dependent services to reliably reproduce degradation scenarios.
